intro: Thelypodium palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's thelypodium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Thelypodium palmeri is a perennial herb that is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
